title: Why does Trump think COVID-19 is a hoax? - Quora

response.answer_text: He doesn’t, that’s just something he says about everything that makes him look bad. 130,000+ Americans dying on his watch? Can’t be, must be a hoax. 3,000,000+ Americans getting infected on his watch? Can’t be, must be a hoax. If he really thought it was a hoax: he wouldn’t require his staffers to be tested before coming near him. If he really thought it was a hoax: he wouldn’t require his supporters to waive their right to sue if they get sick from attending his rally. If he really thought it was a hoax: he wouldn’t suggest his constituents drink bleach, inject themselves with Lysol, or take unproven drugs. We’re almost 6 months since the first US COVID case and 3 months since the peaks of cases and deaths back in April when the nation’s densest, most populous city was getting hit hard, but unlike much of the world, we’ve made no progress. We’re now breaking records day after day in numerous large cities and states around the country, with a repeat of all the same issues from before, as if we learned nothing and gained no advantage in all the time that’s passed. It’s hard to come up with the right analogy to put this in proper perspective, but it’s as if we had the 9/11 attacks, and then a few months later got attacked exactly the same way, again and again. But to be clear, I mean exactly the same way. It wasn’t terrorists adapting, it was terrorists following the exact same plan that worked the first time, with our government utterly failing to learn from experience; no additional screening for people with one way tickets, no hardening of cockpit doors, no banning of box cutters, no increase in air marshals, no intelligence sharing between agencies, no freezing terrorist finances, no attacks on training camps or pursuit of masterminds, no follow-ups on student pilots with no interest in learning how to land…no corrections whatsoever. So we get hit and lose 3,000 people. And then another 3,000. And then another. And another. Again and again and again. Instead of a national approach to a national problem, we get a president telling the states to figure it out themselves, with a patchwork of inconsistent approaches, making them compete with each other for a limited supply of screening technologies. He doesn’t want to be blamed for failure to prevent additional deaths, so he takes no responsibility, but encourages states to weaken airport security and complains about every measure they take. Instead of the public collectively deciding they’d risk sacrificing themselves to overpower the terrorists and re-take the plane so they couldn’t be used as weapons of mass destruction, we have a chunk of one political party saying “who cares if people die?! I’m not going to inconvenience myself to save thousands of lives!” And instead of “see something, say something” campaigns encouraging vigilance from the public, we’re given mixed messages. It’s not at all difficult to imagine Trump immediately and regularly contradicting his own government’s public safety campaign, “Some people say you should say something, but I don’t like saying something. You don’t have to say something, okay? A lot of people don’t want to say something, and that’s okay, too.” We had 9/11 “truthers” calling it a hoax, but at least none of them were President of the United States.  EDIT: Recently released recordings made in February 2020 reveal Trump admitting he knew COVID-19 was extremely deadly and not a hoax.
